testsuite.name: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)
testcase.name: Case 179: Verify that the attachment will be displayed as text when not specifying -b param

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)
testcase.name: Case 180: Verify that the attachment will be displayed as text when specifying -b param

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)
testcase.name: Case 181: Verify that if user specify non-existed folder, this folder will be created

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)
testcase.name: Case 184-185-186: Verify the case with attachment are text files, image files or exe files (doc, xls, csv, png, jpg, exe)

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)
testcase.name: Case 187: Verify that the attachment will NOT be downloaded if user does NOT have proper permissions

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data with attachment (-b)
testcase.name: Case 188: In combination with params -o -e -q, verify that the attachment will be downloaded when specifying -b

testsuite.name: Export with --export option: Export data using query (-q)

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data using query (-q)
testcase.name: Case 167: Verify that data will be returned when using the query with -q include limit, offset

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data using query (-q)
testcase.name: Case 168: Verify that the error message will be returned in file exported when using the query which doesnot match any record

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data using query (-q)
testcase.name: Case 169: Verify that error will be displayed when using non-existed field code

testcase.classname: Export with --export option: Export data using query (-q)
testcase.name: Case 170: Verify that error will be displayed when using invalid query format
